thread.title: Kate Middleton just wore the most Cinderella shoes ever, and here’s how to get them for way less
thread.title_full: Kate Middleton just wore the most Cinderella shoes ever, and here’s how to get them for way less

author: Teri Wilson
title: Kate Middleton just wore the most Cinderella shoes ever, and here’s how to get them for way less

organizations.name: inc international concepts zitah rhinestone evening pumps

text:
Kate Middleton just wore the most Cinderella shoes ever, and here’s how to get them for way less Buckingham Palace threw a party Monday night and tragically, our invitation got lost in the mail. *sob* But all is forgiven because Duchess Kate looked so much like Cinderella that we could see her shimmering perfection clear across the pond.
The event was a reception to celebrate Britain’s relationship with India. 2017 marks the 70th year of India’s independence from England and has been officially named the U.K-India Year of Culture. As you might recall, Prince William and Duchess Kate visited India and Bhutan last year on an official royal tour and from the looks of their photos , it was pretty much a dream vacation.
The reception on Monday was a major bash. Not only were all the high ranking royals in attendance, but there were also Indian dancers, a menu featuring decadent Indian cuisine and a guest list that included fashion designers, actors, writers, artists and athletes of Indian descent. Because if anyone knows how to throw a party, it’s the Queen of England.
The Duchess of Cambridge arrived in full-princess mode, wearing a glittering dress from the British fashion label Erdem . She looked like a glass of fizzy champagne, and we love it. We love it hard.
Yui Mok - WPA Pool/Getty Images This whole look is giving us Cinderella vibes like we’ve never had before.

But the shoes, you guys. THE SHOES. Look at them!
Yui Mok - WPA Pool/Getty Images I mean, they’re basically the modern-day version of a glass slipper.
The shoes are platinum lamé pumps from designer Oscar de la Renta, so you don’t even need a fairy godmother to get your hands (feet?) on a pair. (But you do need a really healthy PayPal account.)
Oscar de la Renta oscardelarenta.com Price: $690.00 
We know. $690 is steep, even for a pair of princess heels. Not to worry, though. We’ve found some less expensive alternatives! We’ve even included a pair of flats on our list, in case you want to channel Princess Kate minus the 4-inch heel.

Vince Camuto Olson Embellished Pump vincecamuto.com Price: $104-170.00 
Steve Madden Glitter Pointed Pumps us.asos.com Price: $92.00
INC International Concepts Zitah Rhinestone Evening Pumps macys.com Price: $89.50 
Call It Spring Nusa Pump callitspring.com Price: $22.49 
Badgley Mischka Daisy-II Pointed Evening Shoe badgleymischka.com Price: $198.00 
Blue by Betsey Johnson Joy Evening Flats macys.com Price: $99.00 
*shoe swoon*
